715246f-a.text:
East 121st Street, west from and including Lexington Ave. Also shown are Nos. 1982-1984 Lexington Ave., at and adjoining the N.W. corner of East 121st Street. Notice elevated roadbed of the N.Y.C.R.R. on Park Ave.
February 27, 1928.
T. L. Sperr.

721117f-b.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, from E. 121st to 122nd Streets, showing a row of uniform residences. View 2 shows the far corner (S. W. of 122nd St.) and an extensive westward perspective to and across Park A enue (elevated road bed of the N. Y. C. R. R. thereon).
February 27, 1928
Views 1,2
L. Sperr

721117f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, from E. 121st to 122nd Streets, showing a row of uniform residences. View 2 shows the far corner (S. W. of 122nd St.) and an extensive westward perspective to and across Park A enue (elevated road bed of the N. Y. C. R. R. thereon).
February 27, 1928
Views 1,2

715245f-a.text:
157-167 East 121st Street, north side, between Lexington and Third Avenues, seen from Sylvan Place, a street one block in length, which runs from 120th to 121st Streets.
July 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

721115f-a.text:
LeKington Avenue at S.E. corner of 121st Street, seen from the
N.W. corner of 120th Street.
July 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

715242f-a.text:
169-171 East 121st SEreet, north side, between Lexington and Third Aves. Building referred to, is the First Collegiate Reformed Church and originally stood at the N.W. corner of 121st Street, and Third Ave. Located at this site since 1884 and is now known as the Elmendorf Chapel,
in menory of Rev. Dr. Joachim Elmendorf, pastor in 1892.
About 1908.

715243f-a.text:
167-171 East 121st Street, north side, between Lexington and Third Avenues. Elmendorf Chapel is at 169-171 East 121st Street.
1AN9  NO 2555  July 24, 1932..
P. L. Sperr.
